text: Utah was admitted to the Union on January 4, 1896. It elects senators to Class 1 and Class 3. Retired. | rowspan=3 | 21 | |- style="height:2em" | |- style="height:2em" | | rowspan=3 | 22 | rowspan=3 | Re-elected in 2016. |- style="height:2em" ! rowspan=3 | 9 | rowspan=3 align=left | Mitt Romney | rowspan=3 | Republican | rowspan=3 nowrap | January 3, 2019 – Present | rowspan=3 | Elected in 2018. | rowspan=3 | 22 | |- style="height:2em" | |- style="height:2em" | | 23 | colspan=5 | To be determined in the 2022 election. ==Living former U.S. senators from Utah== , there were two living former U.S. senators from Utah. The most recent senator to die was Bob Bennett of Class 3 (1993-2011) on May 4, 2016. The most recent Class 1 senator to die was Frank Moss (1959-1977) on January 29, 2003. Senator Term of office Class Date of birth (and age) Jake Garn 1974–1993 3 Orrin Hatch 1977–2019 1 ==References== * Utah
